page.title: 19Attitudes about Stansted.
page.content: In the summer of 1985 the major topic of conversation in Sheering is the planned development of{Stansted {Airport}to be London'S Third Airport. Most people in Sheering are not in favour of this development.People think that there will be too much {noise}from the planes,especially in Lower Sheering.They also are worried about the{traffic increasing,especially in the Main Street.The Parish Council is further concerned that Harlow might expand its population to 130,000 and begin building on Sheering's land. A few people are in favour of the development of Stansted Airport,because they think the airport will bring more{jobs}and the price of housing will rise,perhaps by 20%.
